description:
The players start at space 1 in Bad Ischl. 
The first to reach space 100 back in Bad Ischl wins the game. 
Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. In Salzburg the players leave the train and go on a sightseeing tour before taking the train back to Bad Ischl. That is, if they're not overrun by a motorcycle, in which case they are out of the game for good.

—user summary

A group of gnomes has gotten lost on their way home. It's getting darker, and the forest beasts are approaching. They must recall all the details of the road to guide themselves to safety before any beast surprises them...

Gnomotecnia is a twenty-card game in which each player represents one of the lost gnomes in the forest. At the start of the game, each player has in front of them four face-down pieces of a 2x2 map. To win the game, players need to correctly assemble a map using their famous good memory.

On their turn, a player can take two of these actions:


    Look at one of their cards.
    Exchange one of their cards with another player.
    Change the position of two cards of another player.
    Lock one of their cards until the end of the game, which means that no one can move it or look at it.


The game ends when a gnome announces that they have remembered a way home, meaning they have finished assembling their personal map. If they've done so, they win.

•••

Un grupo de gnomos se pierden camino a casa, está atardeciendo y las bestias comienzan a aparecer. Deben hacer memoria y recordar todos los detalles del camino para guiarse antes que alguna bestia los sorprenda desprevenidos.

Boba Mahjong is a 2-player mahjong variant card game using set collection and rummy mechanics. In the game, players create sets of three cards during their turn. After creating a set, the player keeps one of the cards as an ingredient card. When a player has five sets of ingredient cards, the round ends. Players will use the best six ingredients to make their boba drink and collect points based on the freshness, smoothness, complexity, and presentation of their drink. The game will continue for several rounds until a player has 30 or more points, and the player with the most points wins the game!

-description from designer

Pier 1 is a Cat Sudoku card game for one talented pier master. In the game, the player is building Pier 1 on a beautiful coast. The goal is to arrange market aisles with unique fish vendors to increase foot traffic. Yes, cats are the ecstatic fish vendors. The player will receive points during construction and more after the final inspection. Beware of cute rodents! They are negative points. When the game ends, the player will receive a star rating based on the points received. The more points you score the higher rating you will receive. Are you ready to be a 5-star Grand Pier Master?

-description from designer

MAGNA ACIES! is a three-dimensional wargame ruleset (i.e. played with toy soldiers and on three-dimensional terrain) that aims to reproduce, in a good balance between realism and simplicity, the great battles of the Ancient world. 
Its goal is also to bring people who have never tried this beautiful hobby closer to the three-dimensional wargame, which allows you to really "play" with the soldiers that we admire and have always loved. MAGNA ACIES! is therefore designed to remain simple and to immediately put you players in a position to really lead an army of the Antiquity, making you relive the situations that in those days could make the difference between victory and defeat.

You impersonate the commander of the army, who gives orders to the various corps from which the army is constituted: at the beginning of the battle, assign orders to your large units deployed in the field, depending on whether your plan provides that each of them must attack the enemy, or maneuver to reach a more favorable position, or even stand still waiting for the opposing charge or the development of events. Units that receive orders must act accordingly, until they clash with the enemy or until you deem it necessary to change the order for any reason.

In short, you are reproposed for the problems that the leader had to face on the ground and only those; this perspective (which can be defined as "great - tactical") involves simplifying (or automatically managing) certain aspects of detail that are not considered here as they are supposedly left to the initiative of subordinate officers, but allows you to play great battles in limited spaces and in a short time.

MAGNA ACIES! can simulate the battles of Antiquity until the advent of firearms; it was designed with classic age clashes in particular in thought, but works well as long as squares of men and horses predominantly confronted with close combat weapons.

I thought "MAGNA ACIES!" to be practical, fast and playable: in 15mm you can play even on tables less than one meter, the rules are round 25 pages including examples, illustrations and various chatter, the game tables and the "army lists" are included in a single A4 sheet, a 150 point game - army on each side can last an average of a couple of hours , once you learned the rules.

—description from the publisher

A fast-paced, chili-peppered chase in form of a boardgame. The notorious mafiosi Don Falconi escapes again from prison, where he is held for illegal distribution of his 'chili-boost' sauce in his pizza restaurants chain. The police from the 3 city-districts is alarmed and tries to catch him, before he can flee the city.

The game has 5 different playing levels from 'easy' to 'diabolic'. So there's a fit for children from age of 6 to strategic thinking board game enthusiasts.

By laying street cards, the street network of the city is build up and as the route of Don Falconi crosses with the routes of the police officers, the police might get blocked in the chase or manage to catch Don Falconi. If Don Falconi reaches an escape card, his escape was successful.

—description from the designer

The Silver Star is the brightest star in the twinkling night sky. Its power allows unicorns to live on earth. But suddenly Laura and her unicorn Star Tail discover that the light of the star is getting weaker and weaker. Help Laura and Starletail find all of the Silver Star's starspikes before its light goes out! Only together can the players make the magical star sparkle again and save all the unicorns.

In this game all children play together and try to beat the game by finding the prongs of the silver star before it reaches the end of the timeline and its light goes out forever. The game lasts about 20 minutes and is suitable for players aged 6 and up.

-translation of publisher's website

Everyone knows dragons love hoarding gold in their caves and laying waste to any would-be intruders. It turns out dragons also have designed their own game using the leftovers...

To play, take turns rolling a fistful of pieces out across the table and flicking your Shield through the scattered Skulls to earn (or lose) points. Hit the treasure chest to bank those points and add them to your total. First player to reach 21 points wins.

The game uses most of the same basic rules as Dragoon: Heads Will Roll but has some additions, changes, different physical components, and new art. If you dig D:HWR you'll be way into this.

-description from designer

There is a lot of excitement in the magical pet shop! Several animals have disappeared without a trace overnight. No question that polar bear Murphy immediately starts investigating. But the master detective needs the help of the players.

In this cooperative game, players work closely together to track down the culprits. Only if the detectives cleverly combine Murphy's clues will they save the magical animals. Thus begins an exciting adventure in which each player plays his part in solving the case.

Sleep, little dormouse, sleep! Everyone is getting ready for hibernation, only the little dormouse isn't tired at all yet. Who can help the little one? It's up to the players! They join in the search for valuable tips on how to fall asleep. In this board game, they move their game piece along the path and uncover memo cards that can help them. The matching motif was not found? Then the next player tries his luck.

On their way, the toddlers meet fox, nightingale, snail and co. who give everything to bring the dormouse to dreamland. Whoever reaches the last path map and discovers the card with the yawning dormouse is the winner! A wonderful party game with a story about sleeping and cuddling for toddlers, parents and grandparents.

Black Hole is a dice and card game in Print and Play format.

Past, present, future, prepare to travel through time and space.

Explore the planets of Kyrum and attempt to piece together the history of Jaakub the explorer.

During a game, you will have to achieve a number of objectives, while keeping an eye on your resources.

Explore the "planet" cards to find different items that will help you in your task.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Black Hole est un jeu de dés et de cartes au format Print and Play.

Passé, présent, futur, préparez vous à voyager à travers le temps et l'espace.

Explorez les planètes de Kyrum et tentez de reconstituer l'histoire de Jaakub l'explorateur.

Lors d'une partie, vous devrez atteindre un certain nombre d'objectifs, tout en gardant un œil sur vos ressources.

Explorez les cartes "Planète" afin de trouver différents éléments qui vous aideront dans votre tâche.

—description from the publisher

Histórias de Pescador (Edição Mini) reimplements Histórias de Pescador, but in a small and portable format. The gameplay remains the same as the original.

It is the last fishing season of the year and everyone got together to tell stories of their biggest catch. Anything goes to get the group's admiration and the title of best fisherman.

During his turn, a player must lower at least one card from his hand, face down, and declare a type of fish. The other players can choose to believe or ask for proof. If the other players don't believe him, the player must reveal his card(s) and, depending on whether he is being honest or not, win or lose points.

The game continues with the players until someone successfully discards the last card in their hand, telling their last story and becoming the best fisherman in the group.

--description from publisher

Antes del Diluvio (a.k.a. "Before the Flood") takes place in the year 2070, just twelve hours before the extinction of the last living creatures on Earth. Robots that now rule the Earth are determined to gather different kinds of DNA as long as it is still available so that they can eventually recreate life on other planets.

Each hour is played as one round. On your turn, you have four action points to draw DNA tiles from different bags, put them into their incubator, or move them from the incubator to your habitat. The tiles have different shapes and sizes and must be placed to fit the habitat or the incubator. Each round has a different objective which, if fulfilled, gets you victory points. After twelve rounds, the player with most victory points wins.

Rack-Stack is played on a diamond-shaped grid of 16 spaces. Each player has eight pieces in their color.

One unusual feature of the game is that the players must pretend that the board is vertical; a piece can only be placed if it is supported on both "lower" sides by other pieces or the board edges.

The other unusual feature is that players may play pieces of either color. However, at the end of the game players only score for their own pieces.

Scoring is for sets of three pieces at the points of an equilateral triangle. These can be made in three sizes which are worth from one to three points.

In Simon's Cat: Total Mess, the deck is composed of pictures with connected drawings and special "Simon's Cat" cards. Players draw cards and lay them in a row until a card with no number in the corner is drawn. The first player to connect objects from the first to the last card and correctly name the last objects gathers all the challenge cards and keeps them. Players guessing incorrectly return a card to the deck. When a special Simon's Cat card comes up, the first player to shout "Simon's Cat!" wins the card for extra points at the end of the game.

The game stops when all the cards in the deck have been used. The player with the most points wins.

Unite to fight evil! Superman, Batman, Wonder Woman, Aquaman, Cyborg and Flash join forces to create the Justice League. Together they will fight evil with their super powers and free the world from the attacks of super villains. Advance from city to city eliminating the "Parademons" to reach the final square where only the survivors can face Steppenwolf and try to defeat him. The cooperative Superhero game where strategy makes the difference.
Can be played as a team or solo. A collaborative game against the game.

—description from the publisher (translated)

The players start with one pawn at space 1 and go to space 50 and change to the round course from space I to XII. Movement is determined by one or two dice. One or more pawns may occupy each space with the exception of spaces II, V, VIII and XI.

If a pawn stands on one of these 4 spaces, lightning stikes all other pawns standing on the same lightning bolt, eliminating them from the game. Then the pawn, that initiated the lightning strike starts anew from space 1.

If a meeple reaches space 50 exactly, it starts anew at space 1.

The player with the last pawn in play wins the game.

—user summary

Each player has 11 tokens which are placed on the black spots on the game board. Movement is determined by a die according to following special rules:

1 - The goal keeper (T) moves forward one space diagonaly. If the keeper leaves the penalyty box, the opponent rolls two times, on a result of 8 or more, he sets the nearest forward- or midfield player on a red spot and scores a goal and the keeper is reset to his starting point.

3 - One of the three midfield players (L) moves 3 spaces in a straight line from his starting point.

4 - One of the five forward players (S) moves 4 spaces in a straight line from his starting point.

2 and 5 - A forward or midfield player not standing on his starting point moves 2 or 5 spaces.

6 - A defense player (V) moves 2 spaces diagonaly forward. If a defense player passes line A, the opponent gets a free turn.

Every time a forward- or midfield player reaches a red spot near the goal of the opponent, a goal is scored and the token remains there for the rest of the game. The first player to score all 8 goals wins the game.

—user summary

Langskip is a 2-4 player bluffing game. You are a Viking who has been mistakenly sent to the realm of Helheim, usually reserved for those who died dishonourably. It becomes a race to Asgard before your fellow Vikings to convince Odin that you should be allowed entry into the glorious golden hall of Valhalla!

On your turn, you can use the power of the gods to guide you through the four realms quicker than your opponents by playing one of the two cards in your hand face down. Still, the other players must choose whether to believe that you played the card you said or accuse you of mischief and reveal the card for everyone to see. If your accusation is successful, you gain a mischief token; if you lie successfully without being accused, you gain a mischief token. Mischief tokens are used to make Loki and his children stronger, giving you an even better chance of arriving at Asgard first.

Will you be mischievous, or will you keep everyone on the worthy path and reap the benefits of their ill-deeds?

—description from the designer

You are the director of a B terror movie, but you have concurrence. You must run to to show your movie in to the audience before your opponents. Gather the perfect crew, find a suitable location and delay your opponents efforts on these funny card game.

Each turn the player buys a card from a shared deck of cards containing all types of cards (from actors to locations) or the top card from the discard pile, and see if the card fits in his goals (according to his script card, some sort of objective card).

After that, the active player must use one action card or discard a card.

The first player to fulfill his script cart is the winner.

The game was self published by the author after a successful Catarse (the equivalent of KS in Brazil) campaign.

A family version of a popular quiz game iKnow. ("Edycja Rodzinna" is Polish for "Family Edition".)

Like in other games from this series, to win you need more than knowledge. You have to know your opponents well in order to predict how they will answer their questions. In the family edition of iKnow, this factor is more important than it was before, because you will not only bet if your opponent answers correctly or not, but also you will have a chance to outsmart your rivals. In this edition, you choose one out of four answers.

AN INTRODUCTION TO THE QUEST!

Killer Bunnies Lite is a simplified version of the full Quest for the Magic Carrot game (start with the QUEST section if you want to explore more). Lite is a stand-alone game is not compatible with any other Killer Bunnies game; however, you can incorporate the 10 Carrots into your full Quest game!

A "big box" deluxe edition of Dungeon Fighter offered during the Dungeon Fighter Kickstarter, for a complete Dungeon Fighter experience. The box contained:

- The components of Dungeon Fighter (Second Edition).
- The components of Dungeon Fighter in the Labyrinth of Sinister Storms.
- The components of Dungeon Fighter in the Castle of Frightening Frosts.
- The components of Dungeon Fighter in the Catacombs of Gloomy Ghosts.
- The components of Dungeon Fighter in the Chambers of Malevolent Magma.
- The Kickstarter-exclusive metal Party Leader token.
- The Metal Upgrade Pack of 30 metal Gold Coins coins and 18 metal Scars.
- The Silicone Trays Pack of two foldable silicone trays.
- The Embroidered Cloth Bags Pack.
- All the stretch goals unlocked in the campaign.
- The Hero Betty Loudscream offered during the campaign.

Defeat the Mutant Mudds and collect the Water Sprites... WITH YOUR FRIENDS! The official Mutant Mudds Deluxe tabletop game uses a dynamic modular board game system and contains 2 bonus Mutant Mudds mini games.

Features:

     Gorgeous hand-painted artwork
     An adaptable Dynamic Board Game System
     2-4 player gameplay
     Combine with other Game Decks (like Mutant Mudds Super Challenge) for fun expansions
     2 Bonus Unique Mutant Mudds Deluxe Mini-Games
     Extra cards to create your own Board Designs


Players must collect Water Sprites by purchasing them with points they earn during gameplay. The player with the most Water Sprites at the end wins!

It's time to get Muddy!

Defeat the Mudd Bosses and collect the Water Sprites... with your friends!

Players can have a blast playing this brand-new official Mutant Mudds table-top game, with 5 super challenging Mudd Bosses and 3 unique maps exclusively featured in Mutant Mudds Super Challenge Game Decks!

Combine Mutant Mudds Super Challenge Game Decks with Mutant Mudds Deluxe Game Decks for an official crossover board. Players can also create their own Board Design to play with your friends! Boost your Board Card options with both Mutant Mudds Deluxe and Super Challenge Game Decks!

Features:

     Gorgeous hand-painted artwork
     An adaptable Dynamic Board Game System
     2-4 player gameplay
     Combine with every other Game Decks Party Styled game (like Mutant Mudds Deluxe) for fun expandable gameplay
     2 exclusive Mutant Mudds Super Challenge Mini-Games
     5 unique Mudd Bosses to conquer
     3 official Board Designs (including one from the creator of Mutant Mudds)


Players must collect Water Sprite Token Cards by purchasing them with points they've earned during gameplay. The player with the most Water Sprites at the end wins!

Vijayanagara: The Deccan Empires of Medieval India, 1290-1398 depicts the epic, century-long rise and fall of medieval kingdoms in India over two dynastic periods, for 1-3 players.

Vijayanagara is the first game in the new Irregular Conflicts Series (ICS). With gameplay inspired by GMT’s COIN system, players will take on the asymmetric roles of the Delhi Sultanate, the Bahmani Kingdom, and the Vijayanagara Empire, navigating event cards and unique action menus as they contest to write themselves into medieval Indian history. Players will rally local amirs and rajas to their cause, construct epic temples, forts, and qasbahs, and battle for supremacy over the Deccan Plateau.

Highlights
1. A sweeping, century-long narrative and numerous epic events.
2. Playtime ~90 minutes.
3. Three asymmetric Factions with different strengths and abilities.
4. A fourth non-player Faction (Mongols) operated by the Bahmani and Vijayanagara players.
5. A new battle-resolution system with strength-dependent risk mitigation.

Vijayanagara is intended for players new to asymmetric wargames and veteran COIN players alike. The factions have distinct capabilities and each is faced with different strategic decisions, offering a very high degree of replayability. The game is streamlined: all player actions and most rules are visible on the table on player aids and cards.

Gameplay and turn order is organized around a deck of unique event cards. With each new card, factions have the option to carry out the event or to select from faction-specific Commands and special Decrees; Commands such as the Conscription of new troops, Governing in Tributary Provinces, and Migration to begin life anew, and Decrees ranging from Demanding Tribute, Conspiring with Delhi’s Governors to betray the Sultan, and forming new Alliances with minor regional powers.

-description from publisher's website
An elementary wargame on Chinese intervenes during the Korean War. Basic system is based on Bonsai Games' Blitzkrieg to Moscow 2 and Russo-Japanese War 1904-1905, using 40 event cards.
A game of modern military exercise based on information processing system integrating C4KISR (command/control/communications/computer/kill/intelligence/reconnaissance/surveillance).
An wargame on hypothetical battle between East Germany and West Germany in 1983. The second game of Kilovolt Design's "Mini War" series.

An wargame on the Battle of Talas, a military engagement between the Abbasid Caliphate along with its ally, the Tibetan Empire, against the Chinese Tang dynasty in 751 AD.

The third game of Kilovolt Design's "Mini War" series.
An wargame on the Battle of Shanggao in 1941 during the Second Sino-Japanese War. The fifth game of Kilovolt Design's "Mini War" series.
The players start at space 1. The first to reach space 100 wins the game. Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

The Game of Flying Obelisks is played on a 9x9 board with two raised 3x3 "hills." Each player has a set of 17 pieces of 8 different types, and there are also 5 neutral obelisks.

On a turn a player moves a piece according to its specific movement rules. Moving to a space occupied by an enemy piece captures it. Moving to a space occupied by a friendly piece creates a stack; a stack can have up to three pieces (with some restrictions) and can move as any of the pieces in it.

By moving pieces to the opposite rank a player may recover lost pieces or acquire obelisks. Obelisks allow stacks they are with to teleport from one hill to the other. (Movement onto and on hills is fairly restricted.)

The object of the game is to capture the opposing globe (which moves like a Chess king) or to occupy both hilltops (the center squares of the hills) and have no enemy pieces on the hills.

Note: this was claimed to be a reconstruction of an ancient board game, but that was an April Fool's joke.

The Ring is a card game loosely based on the US election process. It is played using a standard deck of cards, a small board, and some markers.

The game is driven by four columns of cards on the table, which each start with a single card. On a turn a player can draw a card from the deck, add a card to a column, or discard a card allowing them to take one or more columns: columns with a total exactly matching the discarded card and/or any combination of columns matching this may be taken.

For each column taken the player places a marker in the top box of an area on the events board (or five markers if they manage to take all four columns at once). There is a marker moving from area to area with each placement, so a player placing multiple markers places them in different areas.

Once all the spaces on the board are full the game ends. Players each one point per marker, except that markers on blue spaces are worth two. A player having the majority of the spaces in an area doubles their points for it. Players lose points for cards in hand. If there is a tie for overall points the lowest player is dropped and the board is re-assessed.

Malleus 1666 is a cooperative dungeon crawler board game for 1 to 3 players. In this game players control heroes intended to prevent the evil awakens from his ancient sleep.

This game uses dice for player attacks and cards for monster actions. You must explore room by room, complete missions, collect equipment (by destroying barrels) and defeat the final boss.

—description from the designer

Discover or rediscover the region of Alsace in 1800 questions by playing with the new Trivial Pursuit rules which will allow you to win a marker triangle on all the squares of the board.

Questions in 6 different themes: 

     History, 
     entertainment , 
     Geography, 
     Art and Literature, 
     Science and Nature, 
     Sports and Leisure.

Semino is a game of chance and strategy. Victory goes to the player who can grow their plant the quickest.

—description from the back of the box

Each player rolls a die and moves their bamboo tube across a grid, collecting marbles in the bottom. Each marble collected pushes colored leaves up to the top until it fully blooms.

Two difficulty levels are included:

      Players may collect marbles of any color.
      Players can collect marbles only of their own color.


—user summary

Halloween Hustle is played with a standard deck of cards and a supply of candy (or other small items).

At the start of each hand each player receives four cards and a supply of candy is placed in the center of the table: one less than the number of players.

The dealer draws a card from the deck and then passes any of their cards to the player on their left, who then passes any card to the next player, and so on; the player to the right of the dealer ends up discarding a card. In the meantime the dealer draws and passes another card, so players end up all passing cards at the same time. Discards are shuffled when the deck runs out.

When a player has four cards of the same rank they take a piece of candy. All other players may then also take a piece. Starting on the second round the player left without a piece is eliminated from the game. After a player is eliminated, of one player has more candy than anyone else they win. Otherwise another hand is played.

A player may pretend to be about to take a piece of candy to fake out other players. If another player takes a piece in this case, they must give it back along with a piece they already have.

Variant rules are provided for younger children.

(The game says up to 13 players can play, but there's no way to get the game started in that case.)

Petrichor is the earthy scent produced when rain falls on dry soil. The word is constructed from Greek (πÎ­τρα) petra, meaning "stone", and (á¼°χÏŽρ) Ä«chÅr, the fluid that flows in the veins of the gods in Greek mythology.

Welcome to the lush world of Petrichor; you are a cloud. Your entire purpose in life is to expand, sire other clouds and water crops. Unfortunately, your mates (who are also clouds) have a similar plan. It’s up to you to manipulate the weather and assimilate these rogue clouds to contribute to the growth of as many crops as possible - all in order to claim the title of Most Valuable Cloud.

Petrichor is an interactive, action selection/area influence game, with 4 simple actions which interact with the various fields in ever surprising ways. The players move clouds with water droplets, and then rain those droplets onto specific fields, to make sure they have the right amount of water for the Harvest. During a Harvest, crops that have been watered enough are scored! Players are able to influence when, and how often the harvest happens. Players need to strike a fine balance between maintaining control of the different fields as well as influencing Harvest, to make sure the two come together at the optimal time.

This Collector's Edition comes with a new Artwork and includes the Flowers, Honeybee, and Greener Pasture expansions.

With backhoe, locomotive, fire truck, shovel loader, tractor, dump truck, and concrete mixer there are seven different vehicles in this domino type game. In each case, the same motifs are placed next to each other. Who has the matching vehicles and manages to be the first to put all his domino cards?

The game is played clockwise, starting with the youngest player. On your turn, you look to see if you can match one of your tiles with one of the tiles in the middle of the table. The tiles can only be placed at the two open ends of the domino queue. Only identical motifs may be placed, for example, locomotive to locomotive or concrete mixer to concrete mixer.

If you have a matching tile, you may place it. Then it's the next player's turn.
If you don't, you must take a tile from the draw pile. If this tile you just took is a match, then you may place it on the table immediately.

The game ends when a player has played all tiles. The game also ends when none of the players can place a card. The winner is the player who has the fewest cards left.

In Colorbs, you’ll try to build the most efficient grid of colorful energy-orbs (colorbs) possible.
Players take turns building and harvesting colorbs.        
Some colorbs have special abilities that makes them worth more points when combined with others in a pattern.
The player with the most points when a grid of 4x3 orbs is full or there is no cards left in the colorb-deck wins the game.

NOTES - Detectives, your help is needed! Searches 35 paper documents for clues, motives and alibis and finds out together why Mr. Luger had to die.
TENSION - The victim's video message and other digital web content turn the detective game into a multimedia puzzle game for the whole family and friends.
INVESTIGATORS - Thanks to the involvement of real murder investigators and real locations, the parlor game promises an exciting story and a unique adventure.
INTERNET - The crime thriller game is suitable for up to 8 players, ages 14+. You need internet access and an email address to solve the murder case.
INSTRUCTIONS - You can immediately follow the trail of the perpetrator - without any instructions! The exciting Escape Room game is also perfect as a gift for crime fans.

Tit'Albert Dan Vilaz is a fascinating and extremely simple game system!
The peaceful Vilaz is invaded by the Tit'Albert who devour the Vilazwas one by one.
If no one reacts, it is otut le Vilaz that is threatened! The game continues until the Tit'Alberts are eliminated or the Vilaz is emptied of its inhabitants.

A turn-based game alternating day / night cycles, the story of Vilaz is told by the Storyteller, who will put the Vilaz to sleep and wake up the actors of this story to play a specific role in this confrontation between the players.
Play as a Tit'Albert to eat the Vilazwas or Cliffeeeeurd the White Hunter, take the lead of the Vilaz by becoming the Sef'Vilaz and eliminate every day a player you suspect to be a Tit'Albert.

Tit'Albert Dan Vilaz is based on Mauritian folklore which describes the myth of the werewolf. Each character in the game comes from local folklore and represents an icon from Mauritian culture.

—description from the designer

After a mysterious message, Tanja is very worried about her brother. The normally very reliable Philipp hasn't answered for hours, which is why Tanja goes looking for him. When Tanja follows Philip's lead, she comes across unsettling information. Will you be able to support her on her journey and find her brother?

Terxo is an abstract alignment game, the more innovative tic tac toe evolution.

(1)build a 3x3x3 cube: at the end, the player who score more points is the winner of the match!

Each dice is different from the others, everyone have a specific Dice-Color, an impressed Sign, and Sign-Color)

(2)You score a point when 3 pieces are sharing one characteristic in common (same dice color, same sign, or same color of the sign)

(3)Aligments Are allowed in every linear direction throw the cube

(4)You can score more than one point at the same time, for example, if you score in more than one direction or two characteristics on the same direction.

Players doesn't have specific pieces, but the avaible pieces and the building cube are for all.

(5)at each turn you receive the piece you have to play from the previous player.
After positioning your piece and declared how many points you score, you have to chose from the avaible dices the next dice you want to give to the next player!

(6) each piece has to be placed in contact with pieces already placed (contact by placed above, on the side or by corner).

This way you never know, from the start, in which direction the cube will develop.
 (7) Do not position pieces over the third dimension (by sides or hight)… The final shape must still be a cube.

(8) Pieces can not to be moved after being placed.

(9)   2 players - Pl.1 VS Pl.2
      3 players - Pl.1 VS Pl.2 VS Pl.3 
      4 players - (Pl.1 & Pl.3) VS (Pl.1 & Pl.3)
(in 4, players plays in two teams with alternated players)

Terxo, This Board Less Board Game is a complete information game with high strategy and easy rules

—description from the designer

Betrayal, Insurgents, and a looming war…

The discovery of an thousand year old ancient Chinese artifact shines new light on the assassination of Chancellor Lài – an event that changed the fate of the Xi Xia Empire forever. Professor Dan Silvers starts the search for the truth which has been buried since 982 AD.

But alone in a foreig country he hits the wall - can you help his investigation from afar?

The first in a series of detective games based on historical events which not only history buffs will love. The game is designed as a historical criminal case and requires investigations similar to those carried out by archaeologists in real life. Use the collected evidence and make your own investigation to bring the truth to light.

—description from the publisher

In a Rummy style of play, put down your spreads and place your chips to match each placed card. Two opponents (or teams of two) play from either end, in a tit-for-tat strategy trying to knock off each other's chips using card spreads to build a connecting link from their Ace to King row. Build your link, break theirs and hold that link until the hand is played out is what makes Gin-Go an exciting, fun and challenging game.

—description from the designer

Firestorm: Villers-Bretonneux is the recreation of the Second Battle of Villers-Bretonneux.

This battle is famous in military history as the first battle where opposing tanks met.

This is a Firestorm battle (not a Campaign), a battle of 4 days in April, 1918.

Dawn of Kingdoms is a worker placement (with a new twist), resource management, tableau building, area control game!

Dawn of Kingdoms is a game that is riveted with intense decisions that are made difficult due to their importance and lasting effects!

Raise your Kingdom to its fullest potential by choosing wisely where to place your two workers each round (1 king and 1 queen). 
After placing their workers everyone collects their respective resources, tokens, points, and building blueprints. They then have an opportunity to build a building from their blueprint collections.

Points can be acquired in a variety of ways. Through area control on the map, hidden victory points from political buildings, from the worker placement board, and from special circumstances due to a constructed building.

—description from the designer
